instance_template:
#const k=3.
#const s=7.
disk(1..k).
peg(1..3).
steps(s).
time(0..s).
on(0,D,1) :- disk(D).
ongoal(D,3) :- disk(D).
generator:
1 { move(T, D) : disk(D) } 1 :- time(T), T > 0.
1 { where(T, B) : disk(B) } 1 :- time(T), T > 0.
on(T, D, B) :- move(T, D), where(T, B).
on(T, D, B) :- on(T-1, D, B), not move(T, D), time(T), T > 0.

hard_constraints.description: Business Requirements: Ensure that only the top disk in a stack is eligible for relocation.
Business Requirements: Enforce physical size compliance where a disk may only be placed on a larger physical disk or a peg; based on numbering, the top disk must have a higher ID than the base.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- on(T, D1, D2), D1 <= D2, disk(D1), disk(D2).

hard_constraints.description: Business Requirements: Prohibit placing a disk onto a stack that is not clear; the destination disk or peg must not have anything on top of it.
Business Requirements: Compliance check to ensure that fixed infrastructure, specifically pegs 1 through 4, are never moved.
Business Requirements: Prevent redundant or impossible actions where a disk is moved to its own current location.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- move(T, D), where(T, B), on(T-1, D, B).

hard_constraints.description: Business Requirements: Maintain a policy that no single disk can be moved in two consecutive time intervals.
Business Requirements: Verify that the final configuration exactly matches the mandated goal state by the end of the specified time period.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- ongoal(D, B), not on(S, D, B), steps(S).

hard_constraints.description: Business Requirements: Ensure logical consistency where a movable disk must occupy exactly one location at any given time.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- #count { B : on(T, D, B) } != 1, disk(D), D > 4, time(T).
